newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's BCI to buy 55 percent of Biverbanc.
newsitem.headline: Italy's BCI to buy 55 percent of Biverbanc.

text.p: Italy's Banca Commerciale Italiana said on Thursday it is to buy a 55 percent stake in Biverbanca for 360 billion lire.
The bank said in a statement that the purchase would be executed in three instalments, 20 percent immediately, a further 20 percent within two years and the balance of 15 percent on October 29, 1999.

BCI said Biverbanca was being bought from the foundations which own Cassa di Risparmio di Biella and Cassa di Risparmio di Vercelli. Biverbanca, with total deposits of 8.65 trillion lire and loans of 1.9 trillion lire operates 88 branches, concentrated mainly in the provinces of Biella and Vercelli. Milan newsroom +392-66102321
